article.title: Two-flavor hybrid stars with the Dyson-Schwinger quark model

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the thick solid black curve represent in both the upper and lower panels of Figure 1?
choices: Pressure and baryon density of 2QM with BDS = 90
Pressure and baryon density of 3QM with BDS = 90
Pressure and baryon density of hadronic nuclear matter from the BHF V18 EOS
Pressure and baryon density of a simple version of the MIT bag model

multiple_choice_question.text: In Figure 2, what causes the phase transition points to shift to larger densities as the value of \'a\' decreases?
choices: Decreasing \'a\' weakens the interaction strength, pushing the phase transition to lower densities.
Decreasing \'a\' increases the interaction strength, pushing the phase transition to higher densities.
Decreasing \'a\' has no effect on the phase transition points.
Decreasing \'a\' only affects the pressure and density of the QM phase, not the phase transition points.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Figure 3, how does increasing the damping parameter \'a\' affect the maximum mass of a hybrid star?
choices: Increasing \'a\' delays the onset of the QM phase and increases the maximum mass.
Increasing \'a\' accelerates the onset of the QM phase and decreases the maximum mass.
Increasing \'a\' has no impact on the onset of the QM phase or the maximum mass.
Increasing \'a\' only affects the radius of the hybrid star, not the maximum mass.

multiple_choice_question.text: In Figure 4, what does the solid black curve represent?
choices: The parameter space where 3QM hybrid stars with Mmax ≥ 2M can exist.
The upper boundary of BDS for the SQM hypothesis.
The lower boundary of BDS under the stability constraint of symmetric nuclear matter against 2QM.
The parameter space where 2QM hybrid stars with Mmax ≥ 2M can exist.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Figure 5, what is the relationship between the mass fraction of QM in hybrid stars and the energy release during the conversion from NSs to hybrid stars?
choices: The energy release is independent of the QM mass fraction.
A higher QM mass fraction generally corresponds to a lower energy release.
A higher QM mass fraction generally corresponds to a higher energy release.
The energy release is only significant when the QM mass fraction exceeds 50%.
